At the outset of this fast’s observance,
we reverently summon:
the celestial immortals’ warrior-officers,
the terrestrial immortals’ mounted hosts,
the Perfected Ones’ cavalry,
the divine beings’ legions,
the sun, moon, and stellar constellations’ troops,
the Three Rivers and Four Seas’ forces,
the Nine Palaces and Five Thearchs’ battalions,
the thirty-two heavens’ overseers of the fast’s rites,
the jade lads attending incense,
the jade maidens scattering blossoms,
the left and right envoys of the Three-and-Five Merit Registrars,
the incense-officials of the Five Thearchs’ daily and hourly watches,
the flying-dragon riders and numinous-treasure celestial immortals,
the jade maidens of the inner courts of all heavens who receive offerings,
the merit-recording envoys of the Dao’s spiritual assemblies,
the left and right immortal officers of the Azure Florescence and Yellow Registers’ true bureaus,
the immortal generals and officers of the Nine Heavens’ Universal Salvation Court,
the departments of the Dark Altar’s Opening Salvation and Primordial Unity,
the Knot-Unbinding Bureau,
the Life-Monitoring Bureau,
the Celestial Physicians’ Bureau,
the Purification Bureau,
the Headgear-and-Case Bureau,
the Transformation-Summoning Bureau,
and all their subordinate heralding officers;
the officers and immortals of this sanctuary’s attendant retinue,
the jade lads and jade maidens,
the principal and deputy officers, generals, and protectors of the Dao,
the inspectors and overseers of the altar,
the officials, lords, generals, and officers of all provincial courts and departments who fulfill their duties and labor in service;
the guardian spirits of this temple,
the city gods of this prefecture and this county,
the true officers of this village and this hamlet’s domain,
the earth gods and principal spirits,
the talisman-envoys of the Three Realms,
the Four Watches’ merit registrars,
the fast’s household earth god and Controller of Destiny,
and the Six Spirits—
all stand at their posts in the altar’s precincts,
each diligent in their toil,
each arrayed in solemn and resplendent vesture.
Accompanying the memorial we now present,
they ascend to the Dark Capital,
there to receive their due merit and reward.

How dare we fail to inscribe this upon our hearts,
to refine ourselves with earnest devotion,
to strive that we may not betray the gifts of our creation,
and to expand the nurturing power of transformation?

May we align with the primordial accord of the Dao,
and so achieve the radiant harmony of the Eastern Florescence;
may we lead the teaching and study of the true,
and so assist the alchemical transformations of the Southern Cinnabar.

chunks.original_text: 臣无任激切感戴之至，谨奉表奏，以闻谨言。 年　月　日具位臣姓某上表 请水火表 具位臣某再拜 上言今月某日为斋法弟子某，崇建某斋几昼夜，开度亡过某灵魂，上生仙界。 以今请降水火炼度者。 臣伏以乾坤定位，敷祖炁以昭回； 离坎分精，极灵功而化育。 五文开廓，万品裁成，欲施九炼之神辉，亶藉二仪之圣运。 臣诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，切虑亡过某灵魂劫尘结习，业垢交周。 返九炁之生根，期还本始； 稽五形之死蒂，莫契虚无。 非陶冶以高跻，曷超凌而直上。 方诸耀彩，挹东井之黄华； 阳燧凝芒，泻南丹之朱火。 匪繇鉴映，孰佐宣扬。 恭惟 太上无形无名，虚无自然，至真大道，无上元尊金阙玉陛下。 道并阴阳，德包覆载。 愿颁勅命，降五龙结璘之英； 载役神真，布九凤郁仪之化。 俾回骸而起死，庶监真以度生。 九遍成人，炁炁返生神之妙； 十回度品，神神昭委炁之玄。 离夜朝元，乘晨御景。 臣无任激切，望恩之至，谨奉表陈启以闻。 臣诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，谨言。 年　月　日具位臣姓某上表 大道表 具位臣某再拜 上言今月某日奉为修斋弟子某，崇建某斋几昼夜，开度亡过某灵魂，以今具表奏闻者。 臣伏以扣九关而昭事，云蔼清微； 崇八陛以对扬，风清黑郁。 徼三极无私之慧，溥十华有造之恩。 雨露涵濡，日星朗焕，敢皈依於枫御，庸倾倒於葵衷。 恪冀高明，洞垂昭鉴。 臣诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，切念亡过某灵魂，冤机织性，罪网萦心。 三惑不除，堕迷途而颠倒； 四维莫守，趋邪径以回旋。 罪花累纪於北酆，愆叶积书於东岱。 茫茫夜壑，惨水火以惊心； 寂寂寒庭，望阴阳而丧胆。 爰崇忏谢，聿建修斋。 自非上圣之海涵，曷俾下愚之春育。 恭惟 太上无形无名，虚无自然，至真大道，无上元尊金阙玉陛下。 巍巍莫极，荡荡难名。 凝妙有以垂精，化敷九地； 孕虚无而毓粹，政溥三天。 诞矜苦恼之哀，广锡慈悲之惠。 伏愿灵光不夜，祖炁长春。 勑勒玄曹，削简书之冤对； 啸命丹局，消录籍之愆尤。 即俾亡过某灵魂，离夜惧欣，乘晨快乐。 超凌三界，无拘留逼合之忧； 勅制九扃，有侍卫送迎之喜。 某敢不仰依化日，期畅玄风。 登碧玉以敷心，勉承凤渥； 觐紫金而拜手，永沐龙恩。 臣下情无任激切之至，谨奉表陈启以闻臣诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，谨言。 年　月　日具位臣姓某上表 血湖表 具位臣某再拜

With utmost reverence and overwhelming gratitude, I humbly present this memorial to make known these words.

Year ___ Month ___ Day
The unworthy official, [Name], respectfully submits this memorial.

**Memorial for the Water and Fire Refinement**

The unworthy official, [Name], prostrates and declares:
On the ___ day of this month, for the disciple [Name] of the fast’s law, who has reverently established a fast of ___ days and nights to deliver the departed soul of [Name] and ascend them to the immortal realms, we now request the descent of water and fire for refinement.

I, your servant, prostrate and reflect: Heaven and Earth are fixed in their positions, spreading the ancestral qi to illumine the turning cycles; Fire and Water divide their essences, exhausting their numinous power to nurture all things. The Five Scripts unfold in vastness, the myriad beings are shaped in perfection—desiring to bestow the divine radiance of the Nine Refinements, we rely wholly upon the sacred workings of the Two Modes.

With awe and trepidation, I bow my head and knock my forehead, deeply concerned that the departed soul of [Name], bound by karmic dust and ingrained habits, is enmeshed in the coils of karmic filth. The root of life in the Nine Qi may seek to return to its origin, yet the stem of death in the Five Forms remains severed from the Void. Without the refining crucible to ascend on high, how may they transcend and rise directly?

The moon’s vessel gleams with radiance, drawing the golden essence of the Eastern Well; the solar mirror gathers its rays, pouring forth the vermilion fire of the Southern Cinnabar. Without the aid of such reflection, who shall assist in their manifestation?

I reverently consider the Most High, formless and nameless, the Void and Spontaneous, the Perfect and Great Dao, the Supreme and Primordial Honored One, Sovereign of the Golden Towers and Jade Palaces. Your Dao parallels Yin and Yang, your virtue encompasses all that is borne and covered. May you deign to issue your sacred command, sending down the luminous essence of the Five Dragons; may you dispatch the divine perfected, spreading the transformative power of the Nine Phoenixes’ resplendent harmony. Thus may the departed be restored from their bones and raised from death, and through the oversight of the true, be delivered to life.

Nine traversals complete the person, as qi upon qi returns to the marvel of the living spirit; ten cycles refine the being, as spirit upon spirit reveals the mystery of qi’s flow. Departing the night to face the origin, they ride the dawn and mount the light.

With utmost urgency and longing for your grace, I humbly present this memorial to make known my plea.

I, your servant, with awe and trepidation, bow my head and knock my forehead, reverently submitting these words.

Year ___ Month ___ Day
The unworthy official, [Name], respectfully submits this memorial.

**Memorial to the Great Dao**

The unworthy official, [Name], prostrates and declares:
On the ___ day of this month, on behalf of the disciple [Name] of the fast, who has reverently established a fast of ___ days and nights to deliver the departed soul of [Name], I now present this memorial to make known these words.

I, your servant, prostrate and reflect: Knocking upon the Nine Gates to serve with clarity, clouds gather in the Pure and Subtle; ascending the Eight Stairs to offer praise, winds are pure in the Dark and Mysterious. Seeking the impartial wisdom of the Three Ultimates, we receive the encompassing grace of the Ten Flowers. Rain and dew suffuse, sun and stars shine brightly—daring to take refuge in the Maple’s Lord, I pour forth the devotion of the sunflower’s heart. Earnestly I hope for your lofty brilliance to cast its illuminating gaze.

I, your servant, with awe and trepidation, bow my head and knock my forehead, deeply mindful that the departed soul of [Name], woven with the threads of grievance and warped in nature, is ensnared by the net of sin. The Three Delusions remain unremoved, casting them into confusion and inversion upon the lost path; the Four Bonds are unguarded, driving them to wander the crooked ways in circles. The flower of sin accumulates for ages in the Northern Feng, the leaves of transgression pile high in the records of the Eastern Tai. In the vast and desolate night abyss, the terror of water and fire strikes the heart; in the silent and cold courtyard, the sight of Yin and Yang shatters the courage. Thus we reverently establish repentance and offer this fast.

Without the boundless ocean of the Supreme Sage, how could the foolish below be nurtured in the spring of renewal?

I reverently consider the Most High, formless and nameless, the Void and Spontaneous, the Perfect and Great Dao, the Supreme and Primordial Honored One, Sovereign of the Golden Towers and Jade Palaces. Your majesty is beyond measure, your vastness defies description. Condensing wondrous being to bestow essence, you transform and spread across the Nine Lands; conceiving the Void to nurture purity, your governance pervades the Three Heavens. You manifest compassion for the suffering and sorrowful, broadly bestowing the grace of mercy.

May your numinous light banish the night, may the ancestral qi flourish eternally. Command the Dark Bureaus to erase the records of grievance; summon the Cinnabar Bureau to dissolve the registers of transgression. May the departed soul of [Name] depart the night in joy and ride the dawn in delight. May they transcend the Three Realms, free from the sorrow of confinement or oppression; may they be commanded to traverse the Nine Gates, blessed with the joy of escort and welcome.

How dare I not look up to the transforming sun, striving to propagate the Dao’s wind? Ascending the azure jade to lay bare my heart, I endeavor to receive the phoenix’s grace; gazing upon the purple gold to bow in homage, I forever bathe in the dragon’s favor.

With utmost urgency and overwhelming emotion, I humbly present this memorial to make known my plea.

I, your servant, with awe and trepidation, bow my head and knock my forehead, reverently submitting these words.

May their qi and appearance be made whole, their protective and nourishing forces restored.

I, your servant, prostrate myself and reflect: the great virtue of ceaseless generation has long been revered for its benevolence bestowed below; with utmost care and humility, I now lay bare the sincerity of my plea. May the dark and oppressive be lifted from earthly confinement, and the mysterious and void be graced with celestial light. With reverence, I bow twice to present my petition and offer my wholehearted entreaty.

I, your servant, with awe and trepidation, bow my head and knock my forehead, reflecting thus: by fortunate karmic affinity, I have encountered this flourishing era. To propagate the Dao and emulate Heaven, I have nearly fulfilled my duty in the dragon’s presence; to receive and proclaim virtue, I have sworn to disseminate boundless felicity. Yet I deeply consider the departed soul of ___, who, entrusted to the female condition, sought to navigate the truths of existence. Ensnared within the web of attachment, she lost the way of earth and wood; entangled in worldly mechanisms, she sullied the purity of gold and blossoms. For nine nights, she sank in the sea of suffering; in a single moment, she drowned in the Blood Lake. The jailers wielded their authority, turning in an instant to test her in the trials of yin and yang; the underworld officials displayed their might, startling her heart with the fetters of water and fire. Without the vast grace of imperial favor, how could she ascend to the transformations of yang?

I reverently contemplate the Most High, formless and nameless, the void and spontaneous, the Perfect and Great Dao, the Supreme and Primordial Honored One, Sovereign of the Golden Portal and Jade Palace. The Dao encompasses all in its embrace, and virtue harmonizes the hidden and the manifest. The benevolent wind stirs the eight distant realms, and all spirits rejoice; the transformative rain nourishes the nine layers, and countless souls beam with joy. May You look upon my earnest plea with favor and grant me the abundant blessings of Your grace.

May the three qi radiate their light, offering hope at dawn’s first glow; may the ten flowers illuminate the darkness, dispelling the gloom of night. Crossing the Crimson Mound, may she have her fate delivered and ten thousand sins dissolved in purity; may her name be erased from the Black Register, and a thousand grievances scattered in harmony. May her spirit be as jade in its purity, her steps light as spring’s warmth.

With utmost urgency and overwhelming emotion, I humbly present this memorial to make known my plea. I, your servant, with awe and trepidation, bow my head and knock my forehead, reverently submitting these words.

This memorial respectfully reports: On the ___ day of this month, for the ritual disciple ____, a grand ___-day fast has been established to deliver the departed soul of ____, humbly beseeching the celestial grace to enable her rebirth in the realm of the living. Further, for the matter of ____, we implore the celestial grace to bestow protection and peace. Tonight, we commence the fast and make this announcement.

I, your servant, prostrate myself, reflecting that the teachings emerged from the Primordial Azure, illuminating the five kalpas with divine radiance; the Dao spread across the Azure Heavens, streaming the ancestral qi to the eight directions. Who upholds the sanctity of the fast’s precepts if not the exalted authority of the master’s abode? Daring to rely upon sacred ordinance, I humbly lay bare my foolish sincerity.

With awe and trepidation, I bow my head and knock my forehead.

I recall that I, your servant, am blessed with felicitous foundations and born in an age of prosperity. Yet in the subtle interplay of yin and yang, I merely mingle with the luminaries of the eastern isles; in the fusion of warp and weft of the mysterious, I cannot fathom the truths of the western precincts. Presumptuously presiding over the jade altar to make offerings, I tremble at the thought of inscribing the jade tablets. I rely entirely upon your lofty wisdom to graciously extend your guiding hand.

Before the sacred presence of the Great Master of the Mysterious Realm, the Perfected Lord:

Endowed with essence and subtle marvels, nurtured in the purity of the Great Void, you govern the Ten Radiant Realms, spreading the divine wind to nurture all; you preside over the Three Caverns, streaming the sun of wisdom to bring forth creation. May you, in your profound compassion, deign to descend in your swift chariot. Issue decrees and establish commands, that I may assist in the celestial order; propagate transformation and transmit the flow, that I may aid in shaping the earthly blessings. May the fast’s merit be perfected, and the imperial grace flow forth.

With utmost urgency and overwhelming emotion, I humbly present this memorial to make known my plea. I, your servant, with awe and trepidation, bow my head and knock my forehead, reverently submitting these words.

May you uphold the sixfold disciplines, displaying the net of law with thunderous authority, and govern the thousand spirits, setting the transformative mechanism in motion with rain and dew.

Before the sacred presence of the Azure Spirit, First Elder of the Nine Qi Celestial Lords; the Cinnabar Spirit, True Elder of the Three Qi Celestial Lords; the Radiant Spirit, August Elder of the Seven Qi Celestial Lords; the Five Spirits, Mystic Elder of the Five Qi Celestial Lords; and the Primordial Spirit, Prime Elder of the One Qi Celestial Lord.

Their virtue illumines the night, their harmonious qi ushers in spring. Arrayed in office and bearing the current, they expunge transgressions to fill the cinnabar registers; the myriad perfected receive their charge, inscribing meritorious deeds upon the mystic charts. Assuredly they return in jade chariots, swiftly turning toward the jasper palaces. Heaven’s radiance shines forth, at once streaming the rain of teachings to suffuse and nourish; earth’s prohibitions open in clarity, widely propagating the vast and boundless Daoist winds.

I, your minister, can scarcely contain my fervent gratitude. With reverence, I present this memorial in thanksgiving.

I bow my head and knock my forehead in awe and trepidation, respectfully submitting these words.

Memorial to the Three Officials

Your minister [Name], bowing twice, respectfully states: On the ___ day of this month, for the disciple [Name] who has reverently established the [Name] Retreat for [number] days and nights, to deliver the cloud-released souls of the deceased [Name], and humbly imploring the celestial grace to enable attainment of the living realm. Praying for expiation on behalf of [matter], beseeching protection for peace, and now concluding the altar and dispersing the retreat.

I recall with humility that purple clouds arise within the forbidden precincts, traversing the golden chambers to grant audience; the dark ranks gather like rain, following the jade tablets to proclaim the decree. The strictness of the retreat’s precepts has been fulfilled, owing to the weight of the imperial authority. With awe and trepidation, I bow my head and knock my forehead.

I recall with humility that I, in error, inherited the mysterious tradition and presumptuously received its vast transformation. Though the rites exalt mindfulness, I have failed to move the divine workings upon the sacred altar; though the scriptures demand solemnity, I have been remiss in cultivating the cinnabar tablets. Having recklessly assumed the foremost duty of response and exaltation, I fear the severe scrutiny of the celestial records. I humbly implore your compassion and beseech your aid from above.

Excising transgressions from the records, they subtly sustain the ranks of office; conferring honors by canonical standards, they universally elevate the thousand perfected. Assuredly they return in jade chariots, swiftly turning toward the jasper palaces. The Dao that is not the constant Dao pities the ten thousand kinds and uplifts them; the mystery upon mystery moistens the ten directions and pervades all.

chunks.translated_text:
Memorial to the Supreme Masters of the Three Caverns

I humbly report that on the ___ day of this month, for the ritual disciple [Name], I have solemnly conducted a [Name] Retreat of ___ days and nights, opening the clouded paths to deliver the departed soul of [Name], that they may ascend to the blessed realms. I have also performed prayers of exorcism for [matter], beseeching peace and protection, and now conclude the retreat with the dispersal of the altar.

I prostrate myself, reflecting that the Dao responds to the Purple Yang, ordering the ranks of the mysterious to assist transformation; governance unfolds in the Yellow Primal, arraying the registers of remedies to dispense grace. Fortunate is the strictness of the retreat’s discipline, which relies entirely upon the weight of the masters’ authority. With awe and trepidation, I bow my head and knock my forehead.

I recall with dread that I, though unworthy, have inherited the mysterious lineage and presumptuously received its vast transformation. The statutes exalt mindfulness, yet I have failed to invoke the divine workings at the altar of mystery; the scriptures prescribe solemnity, yet my heart has not fully cultivated the cinnabar tablets. Presuming to lead the foremost office of response and proclamation, I fear incurring the severe judgments of the records. I look up, hoping for compassion, and bow down, praying for deliverance.

With reverence, I address the Masters before whom this memorial is presented: the Venerable Scripture Master of the Numinous Treasure, the Venerable Register Master of the Numinous Treasure, and the Venerable Deliverance Master of the Numinous Treasure. The balance of the Water Office is just, the mirror of ice impartial. They reward the true and numinous, inscribing merit upon the azure tablets; they uphold the ranks of the manifest, excising transgressions from the mysterious registers. Assuredly they return in jade chariots, swiftly turning toward the jasper palaces. The ten thousand heavens and ten thousand earths are equally molded by the benevolence of the mysterious ultimate; the one yin and one yang together encompass the gracious blessings of the vast primal harmony. I can scarcely contain my fervent gratitude. With reverence, I present this memorial in thanksgiving.

I bow my head and knock my forehead in awe and trepidation, respectfully submitting these words.

On the ___ day of the ___ month, your minister [Name], holding office, humbly presents this memorial.

**Memorial to Unveil and Communicate with the True**

Your humble servant, the minor ritual officer [Name], bowing twice with awe and trepidation, knocks his forehead to the ground, and respectfully states:

I prostrate myself, reflecting that the hundred thousand myriad layers of the Dao’s qi crystallize into jade-like radiance; the thirty-six divisions of the sacred scriptures expound the teachings of the golden perfected. I look up to the crimson palaces where dragons and phoenixes ascend, and bow before the solemn ranks of the mysterious altar, where mandarin ducks and egrets stand in order. Daring to purify the bamboo slips and first set forth my sincere words, I bow my head and knock my forehead in awe and trepidation.

Yesterday, according to the ritual statutes, the disciple [Name] requested that a [Name] Retreat of ___ days and nights be solemnly conducted at [location]. To open the clouded paths and deliver the departed soul of [Name], I looked up, beseeching the celestial grace, that they might attain rebirth in the blessed realms. For the prayers of exorcism regarding [matter], I looked up, beseeching the celestial grace, to safeguard peace and protection.

As one charged with upholding the teachings, I could not justly refuse. Reverently following the mysterious statutes, I conducted the rites in proper sequence.

I recall with dread that I have long relied upon the transforming light and vowed to spread the true wind. Leading the multitude of tasks, I aspired to hasten the dawn upon the forbidden paths; governing the Three Caverns, I pledged to expound the secrets from the jasper sac. Above, I sought to illuminate and turn the celestial chapters; below, to receive and proclaim the imperial mandate. Arraying the eight terraces, I mirrored the nine heavens. Behold the terrace of the Three Flowers, towering through kalpas, wreathed in purple mist; gaze upon the gate of the Seven Treasures, vast and sunlit, veiled in rosy clouds. Without ascending by jade decree, how could one approach the golden chambers and present memorials?

With reverence, I address the Most High, Formless and Nameless, the Void and Spontaneous, the Utmost True and Great Dao, the Supreme Primordial August One before the Golden Gates and Jade Steps. Your divine work is not self-willed; your sagely transformation knows no bounds. The azure vault resounds with empty song, illuminating the five patterns and expanding the vast; the purple void flourishes in luxuriance, dividing the three luminaries to bring forth clarity. Lofty and ever loftier, you ascend beyond all ascent.

I pray that you may extend your favor at the phoenix throne and permit direct approach to the dragon [seat]. May the assembly celebrate the winds and clouds, as the ten poles gather the radiance of the numinous light; may your beneficent rain and dew shine forth, as the eight distances receive the splendor of the ancestral qi. Far and near, all receive your grace; the hidden and the manifest are bathed in your blessings. May your influence flow unceasingly through the kalpas, that I may forever support and revere the mysterious origin.

I can scarcely contain my longing as I gaze toward the heavens and yearn for the sagely presence. With reverence, I present this memorial to make known my plea.

I bow my head and knock my forehead in awe and trepidation, respectfully submitting these words.

On the ___ day of the ___ month, your minister [Name], holding office, humbly presents this memorial.

**The Supreme Memorials of the Three Caverns, First Scroll, Concludes**

**The Supreme Memorials of the Three Caverns, Second Scroll**

**Memorial to Break Open Fengdu and Initiate the Dao’s Work**

Your minister [Name], bowing twice with awe and trepidation, knocks his forehead to the ground, and respectfully states:

I am but a worthless timber, a humble reed, fortunate by past blessings to be recklessly attached to the ranks of the true. My merits are not even as round as a grain of millet, while my transgressions accumulate like mountains and abysses. By your gracious forbearance, I have not been condemned to destruction. I vow to exert myself in cultivation, striving to repay your kindness. Having received this petition, how dare I not report it?

I reverently consider the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Six Caverns and Ten Palaces, the dark passes and shadowy nights, the trials by water and fire, the bonds of life and death. Enduring bitterness through the ages, they revolve through a thousand kalpas. Though the deluded karma of sentient beings is self-inflicted, the benevolent grace of the Supreme Mystery is worthy of compassion. Without relying upon pardon and absolution, how could they attain transcendence?

I humbly present a memorial, praying that it may ascend to the Three Heavens. I hope that your compassion may incline toward mercy, and that you may specially bestow the qi of the Jade Clarity Dao and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure, illuminating the ten directions and brightening the nine ramparts. May the departed [Name], together with their nine ancestors and seven generations, their kindred through countless kalpas, the six paths and four births, and all classes of hidden souls, be bathed in the wondrous qi, suddenly awaken to their true hearts, and have their karmic debts from past kalpas instantly dissolved.

I respectfully invoke the Flying Celestial Messengers of the Ten Directions and the Jade Boys and Girls who deliver from suffering, to ascend to the Golden Gates and Jade Steps before the Three Heavens, and request the descent of the Primordial Beginning’s decrees, the golden registers, the white tablets, and the true talismans of deliverance. May these be proclaimed to the Three Realms of the Ten Directions, the boundless divine realms, the Offices of Heaven, Earth, and Water, the yin and yang records of transgressions, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, the hundred and twenty courts, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the inner and outer palace caverns, the Avīci Hell and the Uninterrupted, the great and small Iron Enclosures, the twelve river sources, the Yellow Springs, the nine dark realms and five marchmounts, the lords of sin and punishment, the five sufferings and three paths, all the great hells, the Five Paths’ capital bureaus, and the underworld offices of enforcement.

By the radiance of these talismans, may the iron cities be illuminated, the torments of suffering shattered, the cangues and fetters removed, the imprisoned freed, and the furnaces and coals abolished.

May the bronze pillars transform into towering forests. May the cauldrons of boiling liquid become icy pools, all turning into lotus ponds. May the ash rivers and searing coals alike turn cool and refreshing. May the mountains of swords and halberds become groves of jeweled trees. May the blazing infernos of flame be extinguished, and the layered adamantine mountains melt away. May all judgments be suspended and equitably resolved, grievances and enmities reconciled. May the roots of evil be severed and expunged, the records of sin obliterated. May pardon be granted to the departed, to so-and-so, extending boundlessly to all lost souls in the hidden darkness—those imprisoned and suffering in torment—so that all may attain freedom and ease. May the sunken spirits and submerged souls each find liberation.

Furthermore, we humbly beseech the sagacious decree to command the Azure Palace, to open the jade casket of the Purple Yang, and to reveal the sacred name of the Compassionate One of Transformative Response. May the Dao flow throughout the Ten Directions, and may all beings return to refuge. May the gates of the Dharma be flung wide, and may the burdened households be swiftly delivered. Thus may the blessings of good affinity pour forth like rain, the divine favors spread abundantly, and all equally bathe in the grace of creation, serving as proof of efficacy.

By the boundless virtue of the Great Dao, we distinguish ourselves to implore mercy. Your humble servant, acting through the Direct Envoys of the Two Offices, the Left and Right Official Messengers of the Orthodox Unity Merit Bureaus, the yin-yang divine seal clerks, the chariot-red talisman clerks, the just-wind courier clerks, the post-horse memorial clerks, the flying-dragon riders, the memorial-presenting phoenix riders, the cloud-dragon memorial riders, the wind-borne memorial riders, the divine-dragon memorial riders, and the flying-dragon and flying-tiger memorial riders—each dispatched in pairs—now, on behalf of the patron so-and-so, respectfully presents this memorial, ascending to the Three Heavenly Bureaus. We prostrate ourselves in hope that the celestial grace may respond.

With utmost reverence and awe, we bow our heads to the ground, kowtowing again and again, to make this known.

chunks.original_text: 空三行 臣姓某属州某县乡里宫观某靖焚修 空三行 太上无形无名，虚无自然，至真大道，无上玄尊金阙七宝玉陛下。 空三行 年　月　日某处拜上 右，凡书章，用黄纸，朱书。 纸高一尺二寸六分，行阔一寸二分，轴宜单幅，幅宜单行。 每行定排十七字。 前一幅掯两行，空第三行方写章衔，迭书。 下写臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，再拜。 此一行不掯字，看长短到何处住。 第四行写上言字，低於职衔一寸。 此行方掯十七字数也。 自上言以下，至后每行掯字如法。 行上留半寸，行下不通走蚁。 人姓名作一字写，不得抽破。 如鬼字、凶字，如死字、贼字，诸不佳字不得在行上头。 如仙字、人字、生字，诸佳字不得在行下头。 写至以为效信即揍云。 恩惟至以闻，低前行一字。 与再拜相去空三行。 以闻后又空三行，叠书臣姓某某州县某乡里某宫观某靖焚修，须自半行写至下，与纸下头相平。 又空三行，叠写大道衔至玉陛下，只掯书四寸三分。 又空三行，自半行写太岁某年某月某日於某处拜上，某下与纸下头相平。 太岁以后皆空纸矣。 书章，不隔日填大道衔。 不隔时，故留某时及陛下一点及以闻字内耳字一直笔。 朱填至校章时方填也。 章可漏上写大道衔具法位衔臣姓某章奏谨封。 方函上写谨谨上诣三天门下具法师衔位臣姓某谨重封，入在章衔内。 章衔长一尺二寸，阔一寸八分，以青丝线三度缠之。 其十字结处及两头，并贴纸印封之。 又入青纸方衔写如前方衔式。 前后以袱包之，此封章法也。 素车白马章 具位臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，再拜 上言，臣赋性疏迂，禀资愚拙。 职忝司於济度，诚敢怠於关闻。 亶冀高真，曲原狂裴。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处，肃建玄坛，依按真科，次第修奉。 臣切惟九幽六洞、三官北酆、冥路幽关，职司考对。 匪藉穹苍之宣告，曷令部卫於形魂。 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天。 伏望慈悲曲垂，矜悯特降，玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，昭耀阴乡，焕明夜府。 即俾亡过某人洎九玄七祖、亿劫种亲、六道四生、诸类幽爽，免沦苦趣，各脱拘维，来诣玄坛，证品升度。 臣谨为上请素车白马大将军一十二人、官将一百二十人，九龙符命使者一十二人、官将一百二十人，太玄玉女一十二人、官将一百二十人，太玄直符一十二人、官将一百二十人，上诣 三天金阙玉陛下，请降太上勅赦生天宝录，告下十方三界，无极神乡、北都罗酆、泉曲之府，三官九署、百二十曹，水火阴阳内外宫洞、三十六狱，无间阿鼻、大小铁围、炎池水沼，四渎五岳、十二河源、五帝考官，六宫掾吏，巨天力士、执罚神兵、司杀司功、司录司命、主考主罪、主狱主非，四明宾公、天门庭长，十宫六洞、五帝大魔、溟泠大神，五道都府、幽台冥掾，长夜鬼官，无量阴曹，咸令知委。 遵承今来建坛之所，颁行符命，侍卫送迎，疾令上件亡魂，众苦荡除，出离地狱，永辞幽夜，睹见光明，黑簿烧焚，业根披散，参朝玄座，受化更生，以为效信。 恩惟 大道，分别求哀。

**[Three blank lines]**
Your subject, of the surname [X], from [X] Prefecture, [X] County, [X] Township, [X] Palace-Observatory, [X] Oratory, respectfully engages in purification and cultivation.

**[Three blank lines]**
The Most High is formless and nameless, the Void and Spontaneous, the Perfect and Great Dao, the Supreme and Mysterious Honored One, before the Golden Portals and Seven-Jewel Jade Steps.

**[Three blank lines]**
Year [X], month [X], day [X], at [X] place, respectfully presented.

To the right: For all memorials, use yellow paper inscribed in vermilion. The paper shall be one foot, two inches, and six fen in height, with each line one inch and two fen in width. The scroll should be of single breadth, and each breadth of single line. Each line shall contain seventeen characters. On the first breadth, indent two lines, leaving the third line blank before writing the memorial’s title, which shall be written in succession. Below, write: "Your subject [X], with utmost reverence and awe, bows his head to the ground, kowtowing again and again." This line shall not be indented; its length shall be determined by the space required. On the fourth line, write "submits this memorial," indented one inch below the official title. This line shall then be indented to seventeen characters. From "submits this memorial" onward, each line shall be indented according to the rule. Leave half an inch at the top of each line, and do not allow characters to run to the bottom margin. Personal names shall be written as single characters, without splitting. Characters such as "ghost," "inauspicious," "death," "bandit," and other unfavorable terms shall not appear at the beginning of a line. Characters such as "immortal," "person," "life," and other favorable terms shall not appear at the end of a line. When writing "as proof of efficacy," conclude with a cloud-like flourish. "With hope that" and "to make this known" shall be indented one character lower than the preceding line. Leave three blank lines between "to make this known" and "again bows." After "to make this known," leave another three blank lines, then write in succession: "Your subject, of the surname [X], from [X] Prefecture, [X] County, [X] Township, [X] Palace-Observatory, [X] Oratory, respectfully engages in purification and cultivation," beginning halfway down the line and aligning with the bottom of the paper. Leave another three blank lines, then write in succession the title of the Great Dao up to "before the Jade Steps," indented to four inches and three fen. Leave another three blank lines, then, beginning halfway down the line, write: "In the year of the Great Year [X], the [X] month, [X] day, at [X] place, respectfully presented," aligning the final character with the bottom of the paper. All space after "Great Year" shall remain blank.

For memorials, do not fill in the title of the Great Dao on a different day. To avoid delay, leave blank the time, the dot in "Steps," and the vertical stroke in the "ear" of "to make this known," to be filled in vermilion when the memorial is reviewed. If the memorial may be delayed, write above: "Memorial of [title and official position] your subject [X], respectfully sealed." On the front of the case, write: "Respectfully and reverently submitted to the Three Heavenly Gates, [title and official position] your subject [X], respectfully sealed again," placing it within the memorial’s title. The title strip shall be one foot and two inches in length, one inch and eight fen in width, bound thrice with azure silk thread. Seal the cross-knot and both ends with paper stamps. Place it within an azure paper title strip, written in the same manner as the outer strip. Wrap the front and back with cloth—such is the method for sealing memorials.

**Memorial for the Plain Chariot and White Horse**

**[Official position]** Your subject [X], with utmost reverence and awe, bows his head to the ground, kowtowing again and again, submits this memorial:

Your subject is by nature careless and stubborn, endowed with foolish dullness. Though unworthily entrusted with the office of salvation, I dare not neglect my duty to report. Humbly I implore the lofty Perfected Ones to graciously pardon my presumption.

In accordance with the intent of the retreat, and as my office requires me to oversee the teachings, I cannot in good conscience refuse. Thus, I respectfully choose this [X] day of the present month to begin at [X] place, solemnly establishing a numinous altar, proceeding in accordance with the true statutes, and conducting the rites in proper sequence.

Your subject earnestly considers that the Nine Dark Realms, Six Caverns, Three Offices of Fengdu, and the shadowy passes of the underworld are charged with examination and judgment. Without the proclamation of the vast heavens, how can the guardians of form and soul be commanded?

I respectfully present one memorial, ascending to the Three Heavenly Bureaus. Humbly I hope that compassion may incline to mercy, that the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the Numinous Treasure’s wondrous light may shine upon the yin realms and illumine the nightly courts. May the deceased [X], together with the nine generations of ancestors, the seven lineages of forebears, the myriad kalpas of karmic kin, the six paths of rebirth, the four modes of birth, and all classes of wandering souls, be spared from sinking into suffering, each freed from their bonds, and come before the numinous altar to attain ranks and ascend in deliverance.

Your subject respectfully invokes:
- The Twelve Generals of the Plain Chariot and White Horse, with 120 officers and generals;
- The Twelve Envoys of the Nine-Dragon Talismanic Mandate, with 120 officers and generals;
- The Twelve Jade Maidens of the Supreme Mystery, with 120 officers and generals;
- The Twelve Direct Envoys of the Supreme Mystery, with 120 officers and generals.

May they ascend to the Golden Portals and Jade Steps of the Three Heavens, and beseech the Most High to issue a divine amnesty and celestial register, proclaiming it to the ten directions and three realms, the boundless divine realms, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the subterranean courts, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, the hundred and twenty departments, the inner and outer palaces and caverns of water and fire, yin and yang, the thirty-six hells, the Avīci and other unrelenting hells, the great and small Iron Enclosures, the fiery pools and watery marshes, the four rivers and five peaks, the twelve river sources, the Five Thearchs’ Examiners, the officials of the six palaces, the mighty heavenly warriors, the divine soldiers who execute punishments, those who oversee killing and merit, recording and destiny, examining and sentencing, prisons and transgressions, the Four Luminaries and the Lords of the Heavenly Gates, the wardens of the ten courts and six caverns, the Five Thearchs and Great Demons, the mighty spirits of the dark depths, the Five Paths’ capital bureaus, the underworld’s officials, the long-night ghostly officers, and the innumerable yin courts—all shall be commanded to know and comply.

At the place where the altar is now established, may they issue talismanic mandates, provide escort and reception, and swiftly cause the aforementioned departed souls to have their manifold sufferings swept away, to escape the earthly prisons, to bid eternal farewell to the dark night, to behold the light, to have their black registers burned and their karmic roots scattered, to attend the numinous throne, to receive transformation and rebirth, as proof of efficacy.

With hope that the Great Dao may distinguish and respond to this plea.

chunks.original_text: 大道，分别求哀。 臣愚谨至再拜 以闻　空行，接尾，同前式 沐浴医治章 具位臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，再拜 上言，臣尘泥漏品，蝼蚁微生，冒膺宣德之班，敢息度人之典。 威颜有赫，采听是期。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓某月某日为始，就某处，肃建玄坛，依按真科，次第修奉。 臣切虑上件亡魂，幽关闭郁，阴垢缠罹。 欲期容体之澄清，必赖神泉之荡涤。 谨为拜章一通，上闻 三天。 伏望慈悲俯垂，矜悯特降，玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，浃灌兰池，辉华沐浴。 即俾亡过，某人洎九玄七祖、亿劫种亲、六道四生，诸类幽爽，蠲消氛翳，洁湛形神，内外洞明，一尘不染。 臣谨为上请，东井玉女华池夫人、浣濯玉女沐浴君吏、日月童子各一人，五方解秽官君将吏、各一百二十人，一合下降。 神化东井黄华之池，西田流汨之沼，汲取石景黄华神水，五方正炁，日月之英，甘露金津，云腴玉醴。 沐浴所度亡魂，灌炼罪尘，涤除障垢。 净结节胞胎之秽，清冤债烦恼之氛。 又为上请，东方青灵始老哺饴以九炁之青津，南方丹灵真老哺饴以三炁之丹华，西方皓灵黄老哺饴以七炁之素浆，北方五灵玄老哺饴以五炁之玄滋，中央黄灵玄老哺饴以一炁之黄英，定魄安魂，自生五藏。 又为上请，金刚百炼、玉液千和、太白流光、元皇散精，解除郁烦，去荡滓秽，身心清净，智慧洞明。 又为上请，天医神吏、尚药灵官、三五功曹、太医博士、砭石小吏、敷药灵官，密运九转芝英、五色神药，布散经络藏腑之中，救疗生前荣卫之病。 即使上件亡魂，宿患清平，沈痾痊愈，精神复旧，肢体洁清，受化更生，以为效信。 恩惟。 大道，分别求哀。 臣愚谨至再拜 以闻 空行，结尾，同前 溥度幽魂章 具位臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，再拜 上言，臣忝列真阶，莫裨玄化，矢心领教，励志度人。 荐干咫尺之威，庸露亿千之个。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处，肃建玄坛，次第修奉。 臣切见冥关幽路，滞魄穷魂。 或水火漂焚，或兵戈谋害，或木石损磕，或挺刃刑伤，或久抱饥寒，或曾遭鸩蛊，或寇盗杀戮，或蛇虎吞残，或王法凌迟，或震雷嗔击，或覆车坠马，或自缢投河，或他境流亡，或从军倾毙，或鬼神拘击，或冤对句连，或喑跛聋（ ），或瘴瘟瘫疰，或胎产损命，或疾病夭伤，或宿抱怨嗟，或常怀忧忿，或玄恩未度，或常赦不原，孤滞千名，沈沦万姓，山林寄影，郊野潜形，流浪无归，实堪哀恤。 惟黄箓，昭示漏泉之泽； 正阴关，求哀望度之机。 臣虽禀承玉符，冒颁大赦，尚虑功德，未遍幽冥。 谨遵无量度人之道，取今月某日夜，修设玄都大献玉山净供，摄召九洲十界、六道四生，诸类伤亡，无边爽识，享食受炼，脱苦超生。 自非大道之慈怜，曷俾众魂之解脱。 谨为拜章一通，上闻 三天，伏望慈悲曲垂，矜悯特降，玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，遍满十方，辉明九野，上极无上，下极无下，接引万类，均赴法筵，涤罪解冤，炼形受化。 臣谨为上请，玉清溟涬大梵灵官，青玄黄箓救苦灵官，功曹、玉童、玉女，各三十二人，仙吏一百人，上诣三天金阙玉陛下，请降元皇慈悲吉祥甘露，赉持天慈赦宥宝幡，一合下降，即为咒洒甘露，溥化斛筵，周遍虚空，无穷无尽，哺饴众爽，充足丰盈，随感来饮，悉皆饱满。

Great Dao, we humbly beseech Your compassion.

Your foolish servant, with utmost reverence, bows twice to present this petition. Following the established rites, we proceed with the *Muyu Yizhi Zhang* (Chapter of Bathing and Healing).

The humble servant [Name], holding this office, prostrates in awe and trepidation, kowtowing repeatedly to address this: I, a being of dust and leakage, a mere ant-like existence, dare to presume upon the ranks of those who proclaim virtue and hesitate not to undertake the canon of saving souls. May Your majestic presence, resplendent and awe-inspiring, deign to heed this plea.

In accordance with the intent of this fast, my duty is to uphold the teachings, and reason forbids refusal. Thus, beginning on the [day] of this [month], I shall reverently establish a sacred altar at [location], proceeding step by step in accordance with the true precepts.

I deeply fear that the aforementioned departed souls, confined in the gloom of the nether gates, are enmeshed in the filth of yin. To achieve the clarity of their forms, they must rely on the purifying flow of divine springs. Therefore, I humbly present this petition to the Three Heavens, hoping for Your merciful descent. May the *qi* of the Jade Purity and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure suffuse the Orchid Pool, bathing them in radiant splendor.

May the departed, [Name], along with their nine ancestral generations, seven forebears, countless karmic kin, and all beings of the six paths and four modes of birth—every shade in the hidden realms—be cleansed of miasmic obstructions, their forms and spirits purified, inner and outer realms made luminous, and not a speck of dust remaining.

I humbly invoke the descent of:
- The Jade Maiden of the Eastern Well and the Lady of the Hua Pond,
- The Jade Maidens of Washing and Bathing, and the Lords of the Bathing Rites,
- The Moon and Sun Lads, one each,
- The Officers and Generals of the Five Directions for Dispelling Filth, 120 each.

May they unite and descend. Through divine transformation, may the Yellow Flower Pool of the Eastern Well and the Flowing Marsh of the Western Fields yield the sacred water of Stone Essence and Yellow Flower, the *qi* of the Five Directions, the essence of the sun and moon, the Golden Nectar of Sweet Dew, and the Cloud Fat and Jade Elixir. May these bathe the departed souls, refining their sinful dust and washing away their hindering filth. May the impurities of their knots and fetters be cleansed, and the karmic debts and afflictions of their grievances be purified.

I further invoke:
- The Green Spirit Elder of the East, who nourishes with the green nectar of nine *qi*,
- The Cinnabar Spirit Elder of the South, who nourishes with the cinnabar splendor of three *qi*,
- The Radiant Spirit Elder of the West, who nourishes with the white pulp of seven *qi*,
- The Dark Spirit Elder of the North, who nourishes with the dark sap of five *qi*,
- The Yellow Spirit Elder of the Center, who nourishes with the yellow essence of one *qi*.

May they stabilize the *po* and pacify the *hun*, naturally generating the five viscera.

I further invoke:
- The Vajra of a Hundred Refinements,
- The Jade Liquid of a Thousand Harmonies,
- The Flowing Light of Venus,
- The Scattered Essence of the Primordial Sovereign.

May they dispel oppressive afflictions, purge turbid filth, and render body and mind pure, wisdom luminous and penetrating.

I further invoke:
- The Divine Physicians of Heaven,
- The Numinous Officers of Medicinal Arts,
- The Three and Five Merit Officials,
- The Grand Masters of Medicine,
- The Acupuncture and Stone Needle Officers,
- The Numinous Officers of Medicinal Application.

May they secretly administer the nine-transformed magic mushrooms and five-colored divine medicines, dispersing them through the meridians and viscera to heal the ailments of their former lives’ *ying* and *wei*. May the aforementioned departed souls find their chronic illnesses pacified, deep-seated maladies cured, spirits restored, limbs purified, and receive transformation for rebirth as proof of efficacy.

Great Dao, we humbly beseech Your compassion.
Your foolish servant, with utmost reverence, bows twice to present this petition. Following the established rites, we conclude with the *Pudu Youhun Zhang* (Chapter for the Universal Salvation of Hidden Souls).

The humble servant [Name], holding this office, prostrates in awe and trepidation, kowtowing repeatedly to address this: Though I am unworthy to stand among the ranks of the true, I strive to aid the transformation of the Dao, pledging my heart to uphold the teachings and dedicating myself to saving souls. I presume upon Your august authority, offering these humble words, though they are but a drop in the vast ocean of beings.

In accordance with the intent of this fast, my duty is to uphold the teachings, and reason forbids refusal. Thus, beginning on the [day] of this month, I shall reverently establish a sacred altar at [location], proceeding step by step in accordance with the rites.

I have witnessed the hidden paths of the nether gates, where lost souls and trapped spirits linger. Some were swept away by water or fire, others slain by weapons or treachery, crushed by trees or stones, or wounded by blades or punishments. Some suffered long from hunger and cold, or were poisoned by toxins; others were killed by bandits, devoured by snakes or tigers, executed by law, or struck by thunder. Some perished in overturned carts or fallen horses, hanged themselves, or drowned in rivers; others died in foreign lands, fell in battle, or were seized by ghosts and spirits. Some were bound by karmic grievances, or afflicted with muteness, lameness, deafness, or plagues; others died in childbirth, from illness, or by untimely fate. Some bore ancient resentments or constant sorrows, or were never freed by imperial grace or general amnesties. Countless names remain solitary and stagnant, myriad families sunk in suffering. They dwell as shadows in forests or hide as phantoms in the wilds, wandering without refuge, truly pitiable.

Only the Yellow Register reveals the grace of the Leaking Spring; the Gate of True Yin offers the moment to plead for their salvation. Though I have received the Jade Talismans and presumed upon the great amnesty, I fear my merits have not reached the hidden realms. Therefore, I follow the Dao of the Immeasurable Salvation of Beings. On the night of the [day] of this month, I shall prepare the grand offering of the Jade Mountain Pure Feast in the Mysterious Capital, summoning the departed of the nine provinces and ten realms, the six paths and four modes of birth—all manner of the injured and deceased, boundless shades and consciousnesses—to partake of the feast, receive refinement, and transcend suffering for rebirth.

Without the compassion of the Great Dao, how could these souls attain liberation? I humbly present this petition to the Three Heavens, hoping for Your merciful descent. May the *qi* of the Jade Purity and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure fill the ten directions, illuminating the nine wilds, reaching infinitely above and below. May they guide all beings to the Dharma banquet, where sins are washed away, grievances dissolved, and forms refined for transformation.

I humbly invoke:
- The Great Brahma Numinous Officers of the Jade Purity’s Vast Expanse,
- The Salvific Numinous Officers of the Azure Mystery and Yellow Register,
- The Merit Officials, Jade Lads, and Jade Maidens, thirty-two each,
- The Immortal Clerks, one hundred in number.

May they ascend to the Golden Gates and Jade Steps of the Three Heavens to request the descent of the Primordial Sovereign’s merciful and auspicious Sweet Dew, bearing the Banner of Heavenly Compassion and Amnesty. May they unite and descend, reciting incantations to sprinkle the Sweet Dew, universally transforming the feast’s measures, pervading empty space without end. May all shades be nourished and sated, their hunger and thirst fulfilled, responding to the call to drink and be fully satisfied.

chunks.original_text: 仰承元始符命，金箓白简，救苦真符，长生灵符，太上生天宝箓，东华青宫九龙符命，宝光罗络，拔度幽沈，不分六道四生，咸受黄箓冶炼。 即使未度者、度未生者、生未升者、升未化者，化。 合符膺券，返阴还阳，超凌人天，以为效信。 恩惟 大道，分别求哀。 臣愚谨至再拜 以闻 空行，结尾，同前 九炼生仙升度亡魂章 具位臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首频首，再拜 上言，臣道未通玄，德难入妙。 屡为人而造请，每拊己以凌兢。 仰藉汪涵，俯加原贷。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处，肃建玄坛，次第修奉。 臣切虑上件亡魂、阴暗久沦，阳光易隔，匪藉黄华而冶炼，曷令碧落以登真。 谨取某日夜遵依，灵宝大法，无量度人，开廓五文，奉行九炼。 先为拜章一通，上闻 三天。 伏望慈悲俯垂，矜悯特降，玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，灌注玄坛，挥明洞耀，即俾上件亡魂，身沐灵光，心涤阴秽，水火炼质，表裹周圆。 谨为上请，南宫度人不死尊神，南极长生大君、度世司马大神，好生韩君丈人，南上司命司录、延寿益筹度厄尊神，回骸起死无量度人真君，度魂上生南宫真君，奉为亡故某人注算金文，定名玉简。 又为上请，太乙救苦仙吏、金阙化身仙吏、朱陵度命仙吏、逍遥快乐仙吏、宝华圆满仙吏、炼度玉司灵宝仙官、玉童玉女、将军使者、功曹主吏，上诣 三天金阙玉陛下，请降元始符命、金箓白简、长生灵符、内音玉字、赤书真文、上生黄箓宝诰，下临坛席，奉为亡故某人破酆都之秽浊，荡泉壤之阴幽。 削落业根，焚烧罪籍，飞度五户，斩割三尸； 建立法桥，回旋云界。 启黄华之宝井，立流火之神庭。 陶冶阳灵，荡除阴翳，上登朱府，下入开光，复返万神，重生九炁。 被登天之法服，驾莲花之宝舆。 径诣天门，朝礼 金阙，逍遥自在，与道合真。 永无轮转之忧，常履熙明之运。 克臻升度，早遂天人，恩惟 大道，分别求哀。 臣愚谨至再拜以 闻 空行、结尾，同前 酆都赦罪章 具位臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，再拜 上言，臣，生居浊世，运际昌期，佩箓参玄，传经悟道。 誓度人而领教，庶补过以立功。 凡有皈依，敢忘关告。 臣谨据斋意，臣切惟三官九署、百二十曹、六洞十宫、三十六狱、铁围无问、泉曲河源、五苦三途、九幽五岳，典司宪令，考对愆尤，愚俗众生，罔明正理，造冤积业，抱恶逞非。 致使名隶北酆，魂归幽夜，拘闭阴狱，囚击终天，痛苦备婴，莫由解脱。 匪赖玄虚之曲赦，曷令罪报之蠲除。 谨为拜章一通，上闻 三天。

Invoking the Primordial Beginning’s Mandate, the Golden Register’s White Tablet, the True Talismans of Salvation from Suffering and Eternal Life, the Precious Register of the Most High for Ascending to Heaven, the Nine-Dragon Mandate of the Eastern Flowery Azure Palace—may their radiant nets of light deliver and uplift those sunk in darkness, without distinction among the Six Paths and Four Modes of Birth, all receiving the refining alchemy of the Yellow Register. Thus, those not yet delivered shall be delivered; those delivered but not yet born, born; those born but not yet ascended, ascended; those ascended but not yet transformed, transformed. May the talismans unite and the contracts be fulfilled, returning yin to yang, transcending both human and celestial realms as proof of efficacy.

With grace, I beseech the Great Dao, distinguishing my plea in sorrow.

Your humble servant, bowing again and again, respectfully submits this entreaty.

[Blank space for ritual conclusion, as before]
*Ninefold Refinement for Ascending Immortality and Delivering the Departed*

Your subordinate, [Name], in utmost reverence and awe, prostrates repeatedly, bowing twice to present this memorial:

My Dao remains unpenetrated, my virtue far from the subtle. Often have I petitioned on behalf of others, each time trembling with self-reproach. I humbly rely on your boundless magnanimity and implore your pardon.

In accordance with the intent of this fast, my duty is to uphold the teachings, and principle forbids refusal. Thus, beginning on the [day] of this month, I shall reverently establish a numinous altar at [location] and proceed with the rites in proper sequence.

I deeply fear that these departed souls, long mired in yin’s darkness, are easily severed from yang’s light. Without the refining alchemy of the Yellow Flower, how may they ascend to the Azure Vault and attain perfection? Therefore, on the night of [day], I shall faithfully adhere to the *Lingbao* Great Rites, the *Measureless Deliverance of Beings*, unfolding the Five Scripts and performing the Ninefold Refinement. First, I present this memorial to inform the Three Heavens.

I humbly pray that your compassion may descend, granting special mercy to send forth the Dao-qi of Jade Purity and the wondrous radiance of *Lingbao*, suffusing the numinous altar, brandishing luminous brilliance. May these departed souls bathe in the numinous light, their hearts cleansed of yin’s filth, their forms refined by water and fire, their inner and outer selves made whole.

I respectfully invoke:
- The Venerable Immortal of the Southern Palace who Delivers from Death,
- The Great Lord of Eternal Life of the Southern Culmen,
- The Marshal Deity of Salvation,
- The Benevolent Lord Han of Life-Prolonging,
- The Venerable Deities of the Southern Office of Life and Record, who extend lifespan and augment destiny,
- The Measureless Deliverer of the Dead, True Lord of Resurrecting Bones,
- The True Lord of the Southern Palace who Delivers Souls to Ascend.

May they inscribe the departed [Name]’s destiny in golden script and fix their name upon the Jade Tablet.

I further invoke:
- The Immortal Clerks of the Great Unity’s Salvation from Suffering,
- The Immortal Clerks of the Golden Gates’ Transformative Manifestations,
- The Immortal Clerks of the Vermilion Mound’s Life-Deliverance,
- The Immortal Clerks of Carefree Joy,
- The Immortal Clerks of Precious Flowery Perfection,
- The *Lingbao* Immortal Officials of the Jade Bureau of Refinement and Deliverance,
- The Jade Lads and Jade Maidens,
- The Generals and Envoys,
- The Merit Officials and Chief Clerks.

May they ascend to the Golden Gates and Jade Steps of the Three Heavens to request the descent of the Primordial Beginning’s Mandate, the Golden Register’s White Tablet, the Talisman of Eternal Life, the Jade Characters of Inner Sound, the Vermilion Script of True Writ, and the Precious Proclamation of the Yellow Register for Ascending Birth. May these descend upon the altar, delivering the departed [Name] from the filth of Fengdu and the yin gloom of the Yellow Springs. May their karmic roots be severed, their sinful records burned, the Five Portals flown past, the Three Corpses severed. May the Dharma Bridge be erected, the cloud realms traversed. May the Precious Well of the Yellow Flower be opened, the divine court of Flowing Fire established. May yang’s numen be refined, yin’s shadows dispelled, ascending to the Vermilion Palace, entering the Realm of Radiant Light, restoring the myriad spirits and regenerating the Nine Qi. Clad in the vestments of celestial ascent, riding the precious chariot of lotus, may they proceed directly to the Heavenly Gates, pay homage at the Golden Gates, roam freely and at ease, uniting with the Dao in perfection. Forever freed from the sorrow of rebirth, ever treading the path of luminous fortune, may they swiftly attain deliverance and soon join the ranks of heaven and humanity.

With grace, I beseech the Great Dao, distinguishing my plea in sorrow.

Your humble servant, bowing again and again, respectfully submits this entreaty.

[Blank space for ritual conclusion, as before]
*Memorial for Pardoning Sins in Fengdu*

Your subordinate, [Name], in utmost reverence and awe, prostrates and bows repeatedly to present this memorial:

Born in this defiled world, I have encountered an era of flourishing fortune, received the registers to partake in the mysteries, transmitted the scriptures, and awakened to the Dao. I have vowed to deliver beings and uphold the teachings, striving to atone for faults and establish merit. How dare I neglect supplication for those who take refuge?

In accordance with the intent of this fast, I deeply consider the Three Offices, Nine Bureaus, One Hundred Twenty Courts, Six Caves, Ten Palaces, Thirty-Six Prisons, the Boundless Iron Enclosure, the Yellow Springs’ winding depths, the Five Sufferings, Three Evil Paths, Nine Yin Realms, and Five Marchmounts—all who govern the laws and examine transgressions. The foolish masses, ignorant of right principle, accumulate karmic debts and indulge in wrongdoing. Thus, their names are bound to the Northern Fengdu, their souls confined to the dark night, imprisoned in yin’s dungeons, fettered for eternity, enduring every torment, with no means of liberation. Without the mysterious pardon of the void, how may their retribution be absolved?

I respectfully present this memorial to inform the Three Heavens.

chunks.original_text: 伏望大德好生，至仁无外，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，朗映十方，焕明三界，冥关幽路，照耀辉华，地累罪魂，应时清净。 即俾上件亡魂，出离夜壑，快睹晨阳，开发苦心，自识宿命，悔过进善，脱苦超生。 臣谨为上请，降真召灵符吏、降真召灵童子，各一人，特为亡故某人恭请，太极真符，告下东极天中、长乐宫内、大慈仁者、寻声赴感太乙救苦天尊，希降威神慧光，普照十方世界，重阴极垒，北都寒池，一一狱中，悉成阳境。 九炼生仙升度亡魂章 具位臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首频首，再拜 上言，臣道未通玄，德难入妙。 屡为人而造请，每拊己以凌兢。 仰藉汪涵，俯加原贷。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处，肃建玄坛，次第修奉。 臣切虑上件亡魂、阴暗久沦，阳光易隔，匪藉黄华而冶炼，曷令碧落以登真。 谨取某日夜遵依，灵宝大法，无量度人，开廓五文，奉行九炼。 先为拜章一通，上闻 三天。 伏望慈悲俯垂，矜悯特降，玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，灌注玄坛，挥明洞耀，即俾上件亡魂，身沐灵光，心涤阴秽，水火炼质，表裹周圆。 谨为上请，南宫度人不死尊神，南极长生大君、度世司马大神，好生韩君丈人，南上司命司录、延寿益筹度厄尊神，回骸起死无量度人真君，度魂上生南宫真君，奉为亡故某人注算金文，定名玉简。 又为上请，太乙救苦仙吏、金阙化身仙吏、朱陵度命仙吏、逍遥快乐仙吏、宝华圆满仙吏、炼度玉司灵宝仙官、玉童玉女、将军使者、功曹主吏，上诣 三天金阙玉陛下，请降元始符命、金箓白简、长生灵符、内音玉字、赤书真文、上生黄箓宝诰，下临坛席，奉为亡故某人破酆都之秽浊，荡泉壤之阴幽。 削落业根，焚烧罪籍，飞度五户，斩割三尸； 建立法桥，回旋云界。 启黄华之宝井，立流火之神庭。 陶冶阳灵，荡除阴翳，上登朱府，下入开光，复返万神，重生九炁。 被登天之法服，驾莲花之宝舆。 径诣天门，朝礼 金阙，逍遥自在，与道合真。 永无轮转之忧，常履熙明之运。 克臻升度，早遂天人，恩惟 大道，分别求哀。 臣愚谨至再拜以 闻 空行、结尾，同前 酆都赦罪章 具位臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，再拜 上言，臣，生居浊世，运际昌期，佩箓参玄，传经悟道。 誓度人而领教，庶补过以立功。 凡有皈依，敢忘关告。 臣谨据斋意，臣切惟三官九署、百二十曹、六洞十宫、三十六狱、铁围无问、泉曲河源、五苦三途、九幽五岳，典司宪令，考对愆尤，愚俗众生，罔明正理，造冤积业，抱恶逞非。 致使名隶北酆，魂归幽夜，拘闭阴狱，囚击终天，痛苦备婴，莫由解脱。 匪赖玄虚之曲赦，曷令罪报之蠲除。 谨为拜章一通，上闻 三天。
chunks.translated_text:
Prostrate, I beseech the great virtue of boundless life and the all-encompassing benevolence to specially bestow the Dao-qi of Jade Clarity and the wondrous light of Numinous Treasure, illuminating the ten directions and brightening the three realms. May the dark gates and shadowed paths be suffused with radiant splendor, and the earth-bound sinful souls be instantly purified. Thus may the aforementioned departed spirits emerge from the abyssal night, swiftly behold the morning sun, awaken their suffering hearts, recognize their past lives, repent their transgressions, and advance in goodness, casting off torment to transcend into new life.

I reverently petition for the descent of the Talisman-Officer for Summoning Spirits and the Divine Youth for Summoning Spirits, each one, to specially invoke for the deceased [Name]. I present the Supreme Ultimate True Talisman and proclaim it to the Eastern Ultimate, within the Palace of Eternal Joy, to the Great Compassionate One, the Most High Heavenly Worthy of Salvation Who Responds to Cries, beseeching the descent of mighty divine wisdom-light to universally illuminate the ten-directional worlds. May the deepest yin’s layered prisons and the Northern Capital’s frigid pools—every dungeon within—be transformed into yang realms.

**Ninefold Refinement for Ascending Immortals and Delivering Souls Memorial**
Your subordinate [Name], trembling with awe, bows his head repeatedly and respectfully addresses: My Dao remains unconnected to the mysterious, my virtue far from the wondrous. Though I repeatedly make petitions for others, I ever chasten myself with trepidation. Looking upward, I rely on boundless grace; gazing downward, I implore lenient pardon.

In accordance with the intent of this fast, my duty as a teacher forbids refusal. Beginning on the [Day] of this month, I reverently establish a sacred altar at [Location] and proceed with the rites in due order. I deeply consider that the aforementioned departed souls, long submerged in yin’s darkness, are easily severed from yang’s light. Without the refining power of the Yellow Flower, how may they ascend to the Azure Heavens and attain perfection?

On the night of [Day], I shall faithfully follow the Numinous Treasure’s Great Dharma of Limitless Salvation, unfolding the Five Scriptures and performing the Ninefold Refinement. First, I present this memorial to inform the Three Heavens. Prostrate, I beseech compassion to condescend and specially bestow the Dao-qi of Jade Clarity and the wondrous light of Numinous Treasure, pouring into the sacred altar and radiating luminous brilliance. Thus may the aforementioned departed souls bathe their bodies in divine light, cleanse their hearts of yin’s filth, refine their essences through water and fire, and perfect their inner and outer selves.

I reverently petition the Southern Palace’s Heavenly Worthy of Delivering the Dead, the Southern Ultimate’s Great Lord of Longevity, the Marshal of Salvation, the Benevolent Lord Han, the Southern Superintendents of Life and Records, the Heavenly Worthies of Prolonging Life and Dispelling Calamities, the Boundless Deliverer of the Dead Who Restores Bones, and the Heavenly Lord of Delivering Souls to Ascend the Southern Palace, to inscribe the deceased [Name]’s lifespan in golden script and fix their name upon the jade tablet.

Further, I petition the Heavenly Worthy’s Salvation Officers, the Golden Palace’s Transformation Officers, the Vermilion Mound’s Life-Delivering Officers, the Carefree and Joyous Officers, the Officers of Perfect Treasure Blossom, the Numinous Treasure Officers of the Jade Bureau of Refinement and Salvation, the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens, Generals, Envoys, and Merit-Officials to ascend to the Golden Palace of the Three Heavens and request the descent of the Primordial Beginning’s Mandate, the Golden Register’s White Tablet, the Longevity Talisman, the Inner Sound’s Jade Characters, the Vermilion Script’s True Text, and the Yellow Register’s Treasure Proclamation of Ascension. May these descend to the altar, purifying the deceased [Name] by breaking the foulness of Fengdu and sweeping away the yin’s gloom of the Yellow Springs. May their karmic roots be severed, their sinful records burned, the Five Households flown beyond, and the Three Corpses slain. May the Dharma Bridge be erected, the cloud realms traversed. May the Well of Yellow Flower be opened, the divine court of flowing fire established. May yang’s spirits be refined, yin’s shadows dispelled, ascending to the Vermilion Palace and descending into the Realm of Radiance, restoring the myriad spirits and regenerating the Nine Qi. Clad in the vestments of celestial ascent, riding the lotus chariot, may they proceed directly to the Heavenly Gate, pay homage at the Golden Palace, roam freely and at ease, and merge with the Dao in perfection. Forever free from the sorrow of rebirth, may they ever tread the path of luminous fortune. May they swiftly attain deliverance and soon join the ranks of heaven and humanity. By the grace of the Great Dao, I humbly plead for distinction and mercy.

I, your foolish subordinate, bow twice more in reverence to inform the Three Heavens.

**Fengdu Pardon of Sins Memorial**
Your subordinate [Name], trembling with awe, bows his head repeatedly and respectfully addresses: Born in this impure world, I live in an era of flourishing destiny, bearing registers and delving into the mysterious, transmitting scriptures and awakening to the Dao. I vowed to deliver others and lead the teachings, hoping to atone for faults and establish merit. For all who take refuge, how dare I forget to proclaim and inform?

In accordance with the intent of this fast, I deeply consider the Three Offices, Nine Bureaus, One Hundred Twenty Courts, Six Caves, Ten Palaces, Thirty-Six Prisons, the Boundless Iron Enclosure, the Yellow Springs’ winding depths, the Five Sufferings, Three Evil Paths, Nine Yin Realms, and Five Marchmounts—all who govern the laws and examine transgressions. The foolish masses, ignorant of right principle, accumulate karmic debts and indulge in wrongdoing. Thus, their names are bound to the Northern Fengdu, their souls confined to the dark night, imprisoned in yin’s dungeons, fettered for eternity, enduring every torment, with no means of liberation. Without the mysterious pardon of the void, how may their retribution be absolved?

I respectfully present this memorial to inform the Three Heavens.

May it please Your Great Virtue, whose compassion gives life and whose boundless benevolence extends to all, to specially bestow the jade-pure Dao-qi of the Yuqing and the wondrous radiance of the Lingbao, illuminating the ten directions and brightening the three realms. May the dark passes and shadowed paths be suffused with brilliance, their splendor resplendent, so that the earth-bound souls burdened by sin may be instantly purified. Thus may the aforementioned departed souls emerge from the abyss of night, swiftly behold the morning sun, awaken their suffering hearts, recognize their past lives, repent their transgressions, and advance in goodness, casting off torment to transcend into new life.

I humbly petition for the descent of the Talisman-Officers of Summoning the True and Calling the Spirits, and the Lads of Summoning the True and Calling the Spirits, one each, to reverently invoke the Great Ultimate True Talisman on behalf of the deceased so-and-so. May it be proclaimed to the Eastern Ultimate, within the Palace of Everlasting Joy, to the Greatly Compassionate One, the Most Merciful, the Celestial Worthy of Salvation from Suffering Who Responds to Cries—may You deign to send forth Your awe-inspiring divine radiance, universally illuminating the ten-directional worlds, the layers of deepest yin, the frigid pools of the Northern Capital. May every prison therein be transformed into a realm of yang. May iron cities crumble, fetters and shackles fall away, and the deceased so-and-so be pardoned, all sins dissolved, grievances reconciled, never to pass through hell but to behold the light.

Relying upon the Celestial Worthy and Supreme Saints, may the Ten Directions’ Flying Heavenly Divine Kings, the Realized Ones of Salvation, the Lads of Salvation, and the Jade Maidens of the Azure Mystery descend in full to the nether prisons. May they shower the Dharma-rain of compassion and sprinkle the precious nectar of sweet dew, so that ice and snow give birth to spring, flames of scorching smoke subside, blades transform into jade trees, swords into blossoming forests. May the biting cold of freezing waters instantly vanish, cauldrons and bronze pillars become cool, the ox-headed jailers all awaken to kindness, and copper serpents and iron dogs forever sever their malevolent paths. May the records of transgressions in the bureaus be erased, the characters of karmic retribution in the ledgers burned. May those condemned to labor—driving thunder, harnessing lightning, drawing waves from the dark sea, bearing stones and hauling sand, circling the celestial round, boring through earth to channel water, moving winds to sweep mountains—all imprisoned exiles, equally partake in this wondrous transformation. May those bound to earthly servitude ascend to the Southern Palace.

Granting this earnest plea, may they be lifted by Your gracious aid. In gratitude, I distinguish this supplication to the Great Dao.

I, your humble servant, bow twice in reverence to make this known. The rites of bathing and refinement follow, as previously stated.

Your dust-borne, lowly servant so-and-so, trembling with awe, kowtows and bows twice to present this memorial. I, a worthless being of the grass and mire, have by error been shaped and elevated to office. Relying entirely upon the perfection of Your creation, how dare I forget my private duty of requital? I vow to rescue the sunken and drowning, striving to fulfill meritorious deeds.

In accordance with the intent of this fast, my duty as a teacher of the Dao leaves me no choice but to comply. Beginning on such-and-such a day of this month, I shall reverently establish a sacred altar at such-and-such a place, proceeding in accordance with the true precepts.

I deeply consider the long night of the netherworld, the dark homeland of the Yellow Springs, where yin vapors coil along shadowed paths, binding beings in the filth of karmic defilement. Souls fall into the frigid courts, spirits return to the abyss of night, shrouded in gloom and murk, their clarity lost in turbid obscurity. Though talismans and proclamations have been issued to summon and gather them, I fear that, mired in the foulness of the netherworld, they may not attain audience. Without bathing in the divine springs, how may their forms and souls be cleansed?

I humbly present this memorial to inform the Three Heavens. May it please Your Great Virtue, whose compassion gives life and whose boundless benevolence extends to all, to specially bestow the jade-pure Dao-qi of the Yuqing and the wondrous radiance of the Lingbao, illuminating the Orchid Pool and transforming the divine liquid. Thus may the deceased so-and-so bathe in virtue and wash away grime, cleansing the darkness that veils inner and outer, dispelling the heat and affliction of body and spirit. May they attend the True Ones to hear the Dharma and ascend to the Mystery.

I humbly petition for the descent of the Five Spirits and Five Divine Lads, five each from the five directions; the Officers of Dispelling Filth, one hundred twenty each; the Ladies of Washing and Rinsing; and the Jade Maidens of Yellow Splendor, one each. May they promptly descend, drawing the yellow-splendored divine water, the refined essence of the corpse, the golden nectar of sweet dew, the cloud-fat jade wine, and the cloud-cream jade liquor, pouring them into the Orchid Bath. May the deceased so-and-so be bathed therein, their toil and dust washed away, their karmic obstacles dissolved. May their five viscera and six bowels be thoroughly cooled, their nine orifices and four limbs all become pure and clear.

chunks.translated_text:
Again I humbly petition for the descent of the Great Generals Who Govern Water and Fire; the Jade Maidens Who Channel the Flowing Essence of the Stone Radiance Water Mother; the Nine-Light Lads; the Fire-Bell Spirit Lads; and the Host of True Ones Who Respond to the Refining of Souls in the Azure Mystery. May they draw the true water from the Pool of Flowing Moisture in the Eastern Well of Yellow Splendor and the true fire from the Courtyard of Flowing Fire in the Southern Prosperity Vermilion Mound, uniting them in descent to refine and cleanse the polluted vapors for the deceased so-and-so. May their accumulated grime be purged and clarified, their adornment perfected for deliverance, that they may swiftly ascend as immortals. May they forever realize the Unconditioned, never again subject to transmigration.

With reverence I beseech the Great Dao, distinguishing my plea in sorrow.

Your humble servant, in utmost devotion, bows twice and submits this petition.

[Space for ritual progression, closing formula as in the "Rite for Ascending and Delivering the Deceased Soul" chapter.]

The undersigned minister, in profound awe and trepidation, kowtows and bows twice to submit:

I, of coarse substance and unworthy talent, have been graced by the resplendent favor of my teacher and privileged to glimpse the subtle and profound. The radiant power of the Emperor shines forth—how may I ever repay such grace? I aspire to broadly propagate salvation and clearly assist in the work of generation and transformation.

In accordance with the intent of the retreat and the duties of my office, which I dare not refuse, I respectfully commence on the appointed day of this month at the designated place, solemnly establishing the Mystery Altar. Following the true precepts, I proceed step by step in the rites.

I earnestly reflect: the aforementioned departed soul has long languished in the dark underworld, bereft of the sunlight. Without deliverance to return to life, how may they attain transcendence and freedom?

I humbly present this memorial, submitting it to the Three Heavens. May the Great Dao, whose kindness embraces all life and whose benevolence knows no bounds, specially bestow the Dao-qi of the Jade Clarity and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure, illuminating the void and brightening the altar precincts. May the aforementioned departed soul swiftly bathe in the divine light and rejoice, riding the refining deliverance to roam freely.

I humbly petition for the descent of the Lords of the Southern Prosperity Upper Palace: the Lord Who Commands Life, the Lord Who Records Deeds, the Lord Who Extends Lifespan, the Lord Who Augments Years, the Lord Who Delivers from Calamity, the Lord Who Delivers People from Death, the Lord of the Southern Culmen of Longevity, the Lord Who Delivers from the World and Commands the Horses, the Venerable Lord of Kindness, and the Boundless Lord Who Raises the Dead and Delivers All People. May they deliver the deceased so-and-so, inscribe their name in golden script upon the jade tablet of fate, and fix their allotted span.

Again I humbly petition for the descent of the Great Spirit Who Commands the Horses, the Great Spirit Who Oversees Life, the Holy Mother Who Guards the Womb-Chamber, and the Lads of the Cavernous Yang. May they refine and deliver the deceased so-and-so, first entering the Precious Well of Yellow Splendor, then the Divine Courtyard of Flowing Fire. May their substance be washed and their form purged, their yin impurities refined away. May they draw the true qi of the Nine Heavens and bathe in the divine radiance of the Five Thearchs. Should I be blessed by the grace of creation and sustenance, may I be entrusted with the rites of salvation and deliverance. With utmost sincerity, I present this petition for your consideration. In accordance with the intent of the ritual, and as my duty to uphold the teachings, I cannot refuse this charge. Thus, beginning on the [day] of this month, I shall reverently establish a sacred altar at [location], proceeding in strict accordance with the true rites.

The six roots and three karmic actions, the five desires and six emotions, drive them ceaselessly through darkness and delusion, until their souls return to the shadowy courts and their spirits retreat to the gates of yin. Entangled by grievances and bound by karmic judgments, they languish in the endless night, pitiful beyond measure. chunks.original_text: 恩惟 大道，分别求哀。 臣愚谨至再拜以 闻 空行，结尾，同前 荡涤血湖章 具位臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，再拜 上言，臣尘泥贱类，草莽微生，误玷班联，滥司济度。 莫报生成之德，誓宣化育之仁。 凡有皈依，敢忘关告。 臣谨据斋意，臣切念亡故某人三生四负，多积冤愆； 六欲七情，易招衅咎。 命罹产厄，神堕幽关。 北酆东岱之曹，纪录姓字； 峡石血湖之狱，考掠形魂。 抱痛终天，无由解脱。 爰念禀生之本始，孰非祖气之分灵。 妄业自招，实堪矜悯。 帝恩无外，谅赐哀矜。 谨为拜章一通，上闻 三天，伏望垂惠重泉，曲加省览，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，洞映十方，照烛长夜。 变阴暗为阳明之境，化血湖为清净之场。 令诸罪人，自识宿命，舍恶从善，脱苦超生。 臣谨为上请，三炁流光符吏，荡涤血湖符吏各一人，官将各二十四人。 上诣 三天金阙玉陛下，请降三炁流光真符、玉元荡涤血湖真符，告下北都罗酆大铁围山峡石无间血湖地狱，即冀符光朗耀，阴壤开明，原赦亡故某人洎见禁经产身亡未得出离者，并与疾除罪簿，落灭恶根，解释冤仇，开通性识，承今符命，获脱冥途。 来诣玄坛，闻经听法，全形复质，随果受生。 又念沦染血腥，形神秽浊，来朝三宝，难近天光。 谨为上请，五方五帝解秽君吏各一人，玉女使者各二十四人，九凤破秽大将军、涤秽大将军、洗秽大将军、灭秽大将军各一人，官将各二十四人，沐浴东井君一人，官将二十四人，浣濯夫人、黄华玉女各一人，仙花玉女一百二十人，一合来下，为取黄华神水、炼尸素浆、甘露金津、云腴玉醴，灌注兰汤之内，沐浴亡故某人，洗除产厌，荡涤秽腥。 俾令内外光明，形神洁净，根尘业垢，并与澄清。 又念亡故某人沦谢之初，自膺痛毒，荣卫伤瘁，未遂安痊。 谨为上请，天医神吏、尚药灵官、治病功曹、太医博士各一人，一合来下，密运神圣工巧，饵以日精月华、玉芝金醴、五色神丹，救疗诸苦，庶得阴阳通畅，血炁和平，经络还元，魂神澄正，朝真受度，托化人天。 永无沦坠之忧，自在光明之界。 更愿灵光炜灿，惠泽周流，业海澄波，血湖息浪，人民品物，并受生成。 舒化日於三途，播仁风於八极。 恩惟 大道，分别求哀。 臣愚谨至再拜以 闻 空行、结尾，同前

With reverence, I contemplate the boundless Dao, beseeching its compassion. Your humble servant, in utmost sincerity, prostrates twice to make this supplication known.

Following the precedent of the *Ritual for Purging the Blood Lake*, I, your subordinate [Name], in trembling awe, kowtow and bow my head to the ground, humbly submitting this petition. Born of dust and mire, a lowly creature of the wilds, I have presumptuously defiled the ranks of the ordained and overreached in my duty to deliver salvation. Yet, unable to repay the virtue of my creation, I vow to propagate the benevolence of transformation and nurturance. For all who take refuge, how dare I neglect this sacred duty of invocation?

In accordance with the intent of this fast, I earnestly reflect upon the deceased, so-and-so, who bears the burdens of three lives and four debts, amassing grievous transgressions; whose six desires and seven passions have readily invited calamity and fault. Their fate ensnared by the perils of childbirth, their spirit cast into the dark gates. The courts of the Northern Feng and Eastern Tai record their name; the prisons of the Gorge Crags and Blood Lake torment their form and soul. They cling to eternal sorrow, with no means of liberation.

Yet, considering the origin of their endowed existence—who is not but a spark of ancestral qi? Their misdeeds, self-inflicted, truly merit pity and compassion. The Emperor’s grace knows no bounds; surely, it will bestow mercy.

I humbly present this memorial, beseeching the Three Heavens to deign to cast their gaze upon the depths of the Yellow Springs. May they specially descend the qi of the Jade Purity Dao and the wondrous radiance of the Numinous Treasure, illuminating all directions and piercing the long night. May they transform the shadows of yin into the brightness of Yang, and transmute the Blood Lake into a realm of purity. May all imprisoned souls recognize their past lives, abandon evil, embrace goodness, and transcend suffering to be reborn.

I humbly invoke:
One Clerk of the Flowing Light of the Three Qi,
One Clerk of the Purging of the Blood Lake,
each accompanied by twenty-four divine officers.

May they ascend to the Golden Gates and Jade Steps of the Three Heavens, beseeching the descent of the True Talisman of the Flowing Light of the Three Qi and the True Talisman of the Jade Prime for Purging the Blood Lake. May these be proclaimed to the Northern Capital, the Fengdu of the Great Iron Enclosure, the Gorge Crags, the Avīci Blood Lake Hell, that the talismanic radiance may shine forth, dispelling the darkness of the nether realms.

I implore that the deceased, so-and-so, and all those imprisoned by the calamities of childbirth, be swiftly absolved of their sin registers, their evil roots eradicated, their enmities resolved, and their nature and consciousness liberated. By this talismanic decree, may they escape the paths of darkness, ascend to the sacred altar, hear the scriptures, and receive the Dharma. May their forms be restored and their essences revived, to be reborn according to their karma.

Moreover, considering their defilement by blood and filth, their form and spirit tainted, they cannot approach the Three Treasures nor draw near the celestial radiance. I humbly invoke:
One Purification Lord of the Five Directions and Five Emperors for each direction,
twenty-four Jade Maiden Envoys for each,
the Great Generals of the Nine Phoenixes for Breaking Defilement,
the Great General for Purging Defilement,
the Great General for Washing Defilement,
the Great General for Eradicating Defilement,
each accompanied by twenty-four divine officers,
the Lord of the Eastern Well for Bathing,
accompanied by twenty-four divine officers,
the Lady of Washing and Rinsing,
the Yellow Flower Jade Maiden,
one hundred and twenty Flower Maidens of the Immortals.

May they descend together, drawing the divine waters of the Yellow Flower, the refined essence of the corpse, the golden nectar of sweet dew, and the jade liqueur of cloud marrow, infusing them into the orchid-scented bath. May they bathe the deceased, so-and-so, washing away the pollution of childbirth and purging the filth of blood. May their inner and outer selves be illumined, their form and spirit purified, their roots, dust, and karmic grime all cleansed and clarified.

Furthermore, considering the deceased’s final moments, wracked by pain and poison, their vital essence and protective qi depleted, their recovery incomplete, I humbly invoke:
One Divine Clerk of Celestial Medicine,
One Numinous Officer of the Imperial Pharmacy,
One Merit Clerk for Healing,
One Grand Master of Medicine.

May they descend together, secretly employing their divine and sagely arts, administering the essence of the sun and moon, the jade mushrooms and golden elixirs, the five-colored divine cinnabar. May they heal all afflictions, that yin and Yang may flow unimpeded, blood and qi harmonized, meridians restored to their origin, and soul and spirit clarified and rectified. May they ascend to the heavens to receive the precepts and be reborn among humans or gods, forever freed from the fear of descent, dwelling in the realm of boundless light.

May the radiant brilliance of the Numinous Treasure extend its beneficence far and wide, calming the waves of the sea of karma and stilling the tides of the Blood Lake. May all people and creatures receive the gift of life. May the sun of transformation shine upon the Three Paths, and the winds of benevolence spread to the eight directions.

With reverence, I contemplate the boundless Dao, beseeching its compassion. Your humble servant, in utmost sincerity, prostrates twice to make this supplication known. The closing ritual follows the precedent.
